001package imagingbook.lib.image.data;
002
003import java.util.Arrays;
004
005import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
006import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
007import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
008import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
009import ij.process.ShortProcessor;
010import imagingbook.lib.color.Rgb;
011import imagingbook.lib.image.access.GridIndexer2D;
012import imagingbook.lib.image.access.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
013
014/**
015 * This class defines a generic container for scalar and
016 * vector-valued image data, using float-values throughout.
017 * 
018 * @author WB
019 * @version 2021/01/12
020 */
021public class PixelPack {
022        
023        /** The default out-of-bounds strategy (see {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy}). */
024        public static final OutOfBoundsStrategy DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy = OutOfBoundsStrategy.NEAREST_BORDER;
025
026        private final int depth;
027        private final float[][] pixels;
028        private final int length;
029        private final GridIndexer2D indexer;
030        
031        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
032        
033        /**
034         * Constructor. Creates a blank (zero-valued) pack of pixel data.
035         * @param width the image width
036         * @param height the image height
037         * @param depth the number of channels (slices)
038         * @param obs the strategy to be used when reading from out-of-bounds coordinates
039         */
040        public PixelPack(int width, int height, int depth, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs) {
041                this.depth = depth;
042                this.length = width * height;
043                this.pixels = new float[depth][length];
044                this.indexer = GridIndexer2D.create(width, height, obs);
045        }
046        
047        /**
048         * Constructor. Creates a pack of pixel data from the given 
049         * {@link ImageProcessor} object. Uses
050         * {@link #DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy} as the out-of-bounds strategy
051         * (see {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy}).
052         * @param ip the source image
053         */
054        public PixelPack(ImageProcessor ip) {
055                this(ip, DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy);
056        }
057        
058        /**
059         * Creates a pack of pixel data from the given 
060         * {@link ImageProcessor} object, using the specified out-of-bounds strategy.
061         * @param ip the source image
062         * @param obs the strategy to be used when reading from out-of-bounds coordinates
063         */
064        public PixelPack(ImageProcessor ip, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs) {
065                this(ip.getWidth(), ip.getHeight(), ip.getNChannels(), obs);
066                copyFromImageProcessor(ip, this.pixels);
067        }
068        
069        /**
070         * Constructor. Duplicates an existing {@link PixelPack} without copying 
071         * the contained pixel data.
072         * @param orig the original {@link PixelPack}
073         */
074        public PixelPack(PixelPack orig) {
075                this(orig, false);
076        }
077        
078        /**
079         * Constructor. Duplicates an existing {@link PixelPack}, optionally copying 
080         * the contained pixel data.
081         * @param orig the original {@link PixelPack}
082         * @param copyData set true to copy pixel data
083         */
084        public PixelPack(PixelPack orig, boolean copyData) {
085                this(orig.getWidth(), orig.getHeight(), orig.getDepth(), orig.indexer.getOutOfBoundsStrategy());
086                if (copyData) {
087                        orig.copyTo(this);
088                }
089        }
090        
091        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
092
093        /**
094         * Returns the pixel data at the specified position as a float-vector.
095         * If the supplied array is non-null, it is filled in and returned,
096         * otherwise a new array is returned.
097         * The length of this array corresponds to the number of slices in this
098         * pixel pack.
099         * The values returned at out-of-bounds positions depends on this
100         * pixel-pack's out-of-bounds strategy.
101         * 
102         * @param u the x-position
103         * @param v the y-position
104         * @param vals a suitable 
105         * @return the array of pixel data
106         */
107        public float[] getPixel(int u, int v, float[] vals) {
108                if (vals == null) 
109                        vals = new float[depth];
110                final int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
111                if (i < 0) {    // i = -1 --> default value (zero)
112                        Arrays.fill(vals, 0);
113                }
114                else {  
115                        for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
116                                vals[k] = pixels[k][i];
117                        }
118                }
119                return vals;
120        }
121        
122        // returns a new pixel array
123        public float[] getPixel(int u, int v) {
124                return getPixel(u, v, new float[depth]);
125        }
126        
127        /**
128         * Sets the pixel data at the specified pixel position.
129         * The length of the value array corresponds to the number of slices in this
130         * pixel pack.
131         * @param u the x-position
132         * @param v the y-position
133         * @param vals a float vector with the values for this pixel
134         */
135        public void setPixel(int u, int v, float ... vals) {
136                final int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
137                if (i >= 0) {
138                        for (int k = 0; k < depth && k < vals.length; k++) {
139                                pixels[k][i] = vals[k];
140                        }
141                }
142        }
143        
144        /**
145         * Copies the contents of one pixel pack to another.
146         * The involved pixel packs must have the same dimensions.
147         * @param other another pixel pack
148         */
149        public void copyTo(PixelPack other) {
150                if (!this.isCompatibleTo(other)) {
151                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("pixel packs of incompatible size, cannot copy");
152                }
153                for (int k = 0; k < this.depth; k++) {
154                        System.arraycopy(this.pixels[k], 0, other.pixels[k], 0, this.length);
155                }
156        }
157        
158        /**
159         * Checks is this pixel pack has the same dimensions as another
160         * pixel pack, i.e., can be copied to it.
161         * @param other the other pixel pack
162         * @return true if both have the same dimensions
163         */
164        public boolean isCompatibleTo(PixelPack other) {
165                if (this.pixels.length == other.pixels.length && this.length == other.length) { // TODO: check width/height too
166                        return true;
167                }
168                else
169                        return false;
170        }
171        
172        /**
173         * Returns a reference to the specified {@link PixelSlice}.
174         * An exception is thrown if the specified slice does not exist.
175         * @param k the slice index (0,...,K-1)
176         * @return a reference to the pixel slice
177         */
178        public PixelSlice getSlice(int k) throws IllegalArgumentException {
179                if (k < 0 || k >= depth) {
180                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("illegal slice number " + k);
181                }
182                return new PixelSlice(k);
183        }
184        
185        /**
186         * Creates and returns a new {@link PixelSlice} with the same dimensions
187         * and out-of-bounds strategy as this {@link PixelPack}.
188         * @return a new pixel slice
189         */
190        public PixelSlice getEmptySlice() {
191                return new PixelSlice();
192        }
193        
194        /**
195         * Returns a reference to this {@link PixelPack}'s internal data
196         * array, which is always two-dimensional:
197         * dimension 1 is the slice index,
198         * dimension 2 is the pixel index (each slice is a 1D array).
199         * @return the pixel pack's data array
200         */
201        public float[][] getPixels() {
202                return pixels;
203        }
204        
205        /**
206         * Returns the width of the associated image.
207         * @return the image width
208         */
209        public int getWidth() {
210                return this.indexer.getWidth();
211        }
212        
213        /**
214         * Returns the height of the associated image.
215         * @return the image height
216         */
217        public int getHeight() {
218                return this.indexer.getHeight();
219        }
220        
221        /**
222         * Returns the depth (number of slices) of the associated image.
223         * @return the image depth
224         */
225        public int getDepth() {
226                return this.depth;
227        }
228        
229        /**
230         * Returns the out-of-bounds strategy.
231         * @return the out-of-bounds strategy
232         */
233        public OutOfBoundsStrategy getOutOfBoundsStrategy() {
234                return this.indexer.getOutOfBoundsStrategy();
235        }
236
237        /**
238         * Sets all values of this pixel pack to zero.
239         */
240        public void zero() {
241                for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
242                        getSlice(k).zero();
243                }
244        }
245        
246        /**
247         * Returns the pixel values in the 3x3 neighborhood around the
248         * specified position.
249         * The returned float-array has the structure {@code [x][y][k]},
250         * with x,y = 0,...,2  and k is the slice index.
251         * 
252         * @param uc the center x-position
253         * @param vc the center x-position
254         * @param nh a float array to be filled in (or null)
255         * @return the neighborhood array
256         */
257        public float[][][] get3x3Neighborhood(int uc, int vc, float[][][] nh) {
258                if (nh == null) 
259                        nh = new float[3][3][depth];
260                for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
261                        int u = uc - 1 + i;
262                        for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
263                                int v = vc - 1 + j;
264                                nh[i][j] = getPixel(u, v);
265                        }
266                }
267                return nh;
268        }
269        
270        /**
271         * Copies the contents of this pixel pack to the supplied {@link ImageProcessor}
272         * instance, if compatible. Otherwise an exception is thrown.
273         * 
274         * @param ip the target image processor
275         */
276        public void copyToImageProcessor(ImageProcessor ip) throws IllegalArgumentException {
277                if (this.getWidth() != ip.getWidth() || this.getHeight() != ip.getHeight()) {
278                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot copy to image processor, incompatible width or height");
279                }
280                if (this.getDepth() != ip.getNChannels()) {
281                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot copy to image processor, wrong depth");
282                }
283                copyToImageProcessor(this.pixels, ip);
284        }
285        
286        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
287        
288        /**
289         * Inner class representing a single (scalar-valued) pixel slice of a 
290         * (vector-valued) {@link PixelPack}.
291         *
292         */
293        public class PixelSlice {
294                private final int idx;
295                private final float[] vals;
296                
297                /**
298                 * Constructor. Creates a pixel slice for the specified component.
299                 * @param idx the slice (component) index
300                 */
301                PixelSlice(int idx) {
302                        this.idx = idx;
303                        this.vals = pixels[idx];
304                }
305                
306                /** Constructor. Creates an empty (zero-values) pixel slice with the same
307                 * properties as the containing pixel pack but not associated
308                 * with it.
309                 */
310                PixelSlice() {
311                        this.idx = -1;
312                        this.vals = new float[length];
313                }
314                
315                /**
316                 * Returns the slice value for the specified image position.
317                 * @param u the x-position
318                 * @param v the y-position
319                 * @return the slice value
320                 */
321                public float getVal(int u, int v) {
322                        int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
323                        return (i >= 0) ? vals[i] : 0;
324                }
325                
326                /**
327                 * Sets the slice value at the specified image position.
328                 * @param u the x-position
329                 * @param v the y-position
330                 * @param val the new value
331                 */
332                public void setVal(int u, int v, float val) {
333                        int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
334                        if (i >= 0) {
335                                vals[i] = val;
336                        }
337                }
338                
339                /**
340                 * Returns the slice index for this pixel slice, i.e, the
341                 * component number in the containing pixel pack.
342                 * -1 is returned if the pixel slice is not associated with
343                 * a pixel pack.
344                 * @return the slice index
345                 */
346                public int getIndex() {
347                        return idx;
348                }
349                
350                public float[] getPixels() {
351                        return vals;
352                }
353                
354                public int getLength() {
355                        return vals.length;
356                }
357                
358                public int getWidth() {
359                        return PixelPack.this.getWidth();
360                }
361                
362                public int getHeight() {
363                        return PixelPack.this.getHeight();
364                }
365                
366                public void zero() {
367                        Arrays.fill(this.vals, 0);
368                }
369                
370                public void copyTo(PixelSlice other) {
371                        System.arraycopy(this.vals, 0, other.vals, 0, this.vals.length);
372                }
373                
374                // returns nh[x][y]
375                public float[][] get3x3Neighborhood(int uc, int vc, float[][] nh) {
376                        if (nh == null) 
377                                nh = new float[3][3];
378                        for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
379                                int u = uc - 1 + i;
380                                for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
381                                        int v = vc - 1 + j;
382                                        nh[i][j] = getVal(u, v);
383                                }
384                        }
385                        return nh;
386                }
387        }
388        
389        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
390        
391        public static void copyFromImageProcessor(ImageProcessor ip, float[][] P) {
392                if (ip instanceof ByteProcessor)
393                        copyFromByteProcessor((ByteProcessor)ip, P);
394                else if (ip instanceof ShortProcessor)
395                        copyFromShortProcessor((ShortProcessor)ip, P);
396                else if (ip instanceof FloatProcessor)
397                        copyFromFloatProcessor((FloatProcessor)ip, P);
398                else if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor)
399                        copyFromColorProcessor((ColorProcessor)ip, P);
400                else 
401                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("unknown processor type " + ip.getClass().getSimpleName());
402        }
403        
404        public static void copyFromByteProcessor(ByteProcessor ip, float[][] P) {
405                byte[] pixels = (byte[]) ip.getPixels();
406                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
407                        P[0][i] = 0xff & pixels[i];
408                }
409        }
410        
411        public static void copyFromShortProcessor(ShortProcessor ip, float[][] P) {
412                short[] pixels = (short[]) ip.getPixels();
413                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
414                        P[0][i] = 0xffff & pixels[i];
415                }
416        }
417        
418        public static void copyFromFloatProcessor(FloatProcessor ip, float[][] P) {
419                float[] pixels = (float[]) ip.getPixels();
420                System.arraycopy(pixels, 0, P[0], 0, pixels.length);
421        }
422        
423        public static void copyFromColorProcessor(ColorProcessor ip, float[][] P) {
424                final int[] pixels = (int[]) ip.getPixels();
425                final int[] rgb = new int[3];
426                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
427                        Rgb.intToRgb(pixels[i], rgb);
428                        P[0][i] = rgb[0];
429                        P[1][i] = rgb[1];
430                        P[2][i] = rgb[2];
431                }
432        }
433        
434        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
435

486        
487
488        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
489        
490        public static ImageProcessor copyToImageProcessor(float[][] sources, ImageProcessor ip) {
491                if (ip instanceof ByteProcessor)
492                        copyToByteProcessor(sources, (ByteProcessor)ip);
493                else if (ip instanceof ShortProcessor)
494                        copyToShortProcessor(sources, (ShortProcessor)ip);
495                else if (ip instanceof FloatProcessor)
496                        copyToFloatProcessor(sources, (FloatProcessor)ip);
497                else if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor)
498                        copyToColorProcessor(sources, (ColorProcessor)ip);
499                else
500                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("unknown processor type " + ip.getClass().getSimpleName());
501                return ip;
502        }
503        
504        public static void copyToByteProcessor(float[][] sources, ByteProcessor ip) {
505                byte[] pixels = (byte[]) ip.getPixels();
506                float[] P = sources[0];
507                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
508                        int val = clampByte(Math.round(P[i]));
509                        pixels[i] = (byte) val;
510                }
511        }
512        
513        public static void copyToShortProcessor(float[][] sources, ShortProcessor ip) {
514                short[] pixels = (short[]) ip.getPixels();
515                float[] P = sources[0];
516                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
517                        int val = clampShort(Math.round(P[i]));
518                        pixels[i] = (short) val;
519                }
520        }
521        
522        public static void copyToFloatProcessor(float[][] sources, FloatProcessor ip) {
523                float[] pixels = (float[]) ip.getPixels();
524                float[] P = sources[0];
525                System.arraycopy(P, 0, pixels, 0, P.length);
526        }
527        
528        public static void copyToColorProcessor(float[][] sources, ColorProcessor ip) {
529                int[] pixels = (int[]) ip.getPixels();
530                float[] R = sources[0];
531                float[] G = sources[1];
532                float[] B = sources[2];
533                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
534                        int r = clampByte(Math.round(R[i]));
535                        int g = clampByte(Math.round(G[i]));
536                        int b = clampByte(Math.round(B[i]));
537                        pixels[i] = Rgb.rgbToInt(r, g, b);
538                }
539        }
540        
541        private static int clampByte(int val) {
542                if (val < 0) return 0;
543                if (val > 255) return 255;
544                return val;
545        }
546        
547        private static int clampShort(int val) {
548                if (val < 0) return 0;
549                if (val > 65535) return 65535;
550                return val;
551        }
552
553}
